title: 112_s1592
content: The "Agricultural Credit Expansion Act" may be cited as the short title. Eligibility for farm loans is addressed in the Act. The "Agricultural Credit Expansion Act" addresses eligibility requirements for farm ownership loans under the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act. It includes provisions for limited liability companies and other legal entities deemed appropriate by the Secretary. The Agricultural Credit Expansion Act amends eligibility requirements for farm ownership loans by including limited liability companies and other legal entities determined appropriate by the Secretary. The Agricultural Credit Expansion Act amends farm ownership loan eligibility requirements by including limited liability companies and other legal entities determined appropriate by the Secretary. Special rules are established for determining eligibility of operating-only entities that will become the operator of a family farm. The Secretary determines eligibility for entities that will become operators of family farms based on ownership percentages exceeding 50 percent or as deemed appropriate. Special rules apply to entities owned by other entities to meet eligibility requirements. The Secretary determines eligibility for owner-operators and operators of family farms based on ownership percentages exceeding 50 percent. Special rules apply to entities owned by other entities to meet eligibility requirements for conservation and farm operating loans. The eligibility requirements for farm operating loans under the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act are expanded to include legal entities determined appropriate by the Secretary, in addition to owner-operators and operators of family farms with ownership percentages exceeding 50 percent.
